content.description: Central Perk, Rachel, Phoebe, Joey, Ross, and Monica are all there as Chandler enters wearing glasses.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Hey, you guys!

content.speaker: Ross and Rachel
content.text: Hey!

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: So, what do you think?

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: About what?

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Yeah, what?

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: What?

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Are you kidding? Okay, I’ll give you a hint; I’ll give you a hint. (Points to his glasses.)

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Eyes! No, no. Your eyes! No. Chandler’s eyes!

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: I got glasses!

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Well, you-you’ve always had glasses.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: No I didn’t!

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Are you sure?

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Yeah-yeah, did-didn’t you use to have a pair? They were really round, burgundy, and they made you look kind of umm…

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Feminine.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Yes!

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: No!

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Sweetie, I think the glasses look great. They make you look really sexy.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Really?

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Yeah!

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: You didn’t think I used to wear glasses, right?
content.parenthetical: sitting down on the arm of her chair

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Of course! (She mouths, “I have no idea,” to the rest of the gang.)

content.description: Monica, Chandler, and Phoebe’s, Rachel, Phoebe, Chandler, and Monica are making some sandwiches.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: So what do you guys want for an engagement present?

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: That’s okay Pheebs, we’re not having a party or anything, so you don’t have to get us…

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: If someone wants to give us a present, we don’t want to deprive them of that joy.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Oh, y’know what you should get ‘em? One of those little uh, portable CD players.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Oh, I already have one.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Not unless someone borrowed it and left it at the gynecologist.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Yeah, and-and-and by someone, she means Joey.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Hey, I know what I want!

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: What we want honey.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: No, you don’t want this. I want to have your grandmother’s cookie recipe.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: You mean the chocolate chip cookie recipe?

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Uh-huh, yeah.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: You mean the one that my grandmother made me swear on her deathbed that I would never let out of our family?

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Dying people say the craziest things.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: I wanted it for years! I was gonna make cookies for my children.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Break my heart—Oh, all right.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Okay. I’m gonna be the mom that makes the world’s best chocolate chip cookies.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Our kids are gonna be fat aren’t they.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Ahoy!

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Hey! How’s the boat?!

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Great! I’m finally getting into this sailing stuff.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Oh, so you finally took it out of the marina huh?

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Why would I do that? It took three guys to get the thing in there!

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: If you don’t sail your boat, what do you do on it?

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Oh, it’s great! It’s a great place to just kinda, sit, hang around, drink a few beers, eat some chips. (He says that as he sits, hangs around, drinks a beer, and eats a chip.)

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Well, it’s good that you finally have a place to do that.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Y’know Joey, I could teach you to sail if you want.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: You could?

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Yeah! I’ve been sailing my whole life. When I was fifteen my dad bought me my own boat.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Your own boat?

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: What?! What?! He was trying to cheer me up! My pony was sick.

content.description: Central Perk, Chandler and Monica are there. He takes off his glasses and starts chewing on the ear piece.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Do you know what I was thinkin’?

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: What?

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Nothing, I just like to go like this. (Does it again.)

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Hey Chandler, what are you doing tonight?

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Uh why, do you have a lecture?

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: No, why?

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Then free as a bird. What’s up?

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: My dad wanted to know if you wanted to play racquetball with us.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Wow! That’s great! Dad must really like you, he doesn’t ask just anyone to play.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Yeah and he didn’t really ask for you, he asked for Chancy, I assumed he meant you.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Well, did-did you correct him?

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: No, I-I thought it would be more fun this way.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: This is so cool, maybe this is something you can do every week.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Or you can sit with him on the front porch and make sure no one steals the trash cans. He does that every week too.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Oh, just so you know, you-you have to let him win.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Yeah.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: He hates to lose.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Oh no problem, maybe I’ll play with my left hand.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: You’re not a lefty?

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Does anybody know me?!
(Phoebe enters, walks up to Monica, and exhales exasperatedly.)

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: What’s wrong Phoebe?

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: I just went to my old apartment to get you the-the cookie recipe and the stupid fire burned it up!

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: No!! Why didn’t you make a copy and-and keep it in a fireproof box and keep it at least a hundred yards from the original?!!

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Because I’m normal! That was the one legacy my grandmother left me, and I know you wanted it as an engagement present.
content.parenthetical: pauses as he figures out how to answer that

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Oh, we have to get you an engagement present?

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Don’t worry about it Pheebs.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: No one got me an engagement present.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Okay, here I wish you health and happiness. (She hands Monica a cookie in a plastic baggie.)

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: An old cookie?

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: This is what happens when you don’t register for gifts!

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: See no-no, I made a batch and I froze it, and this is the only one left.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: We can’t accept this.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Why not?

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: ‘Cause it’s gross.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: No! Wait! I think I can figure out the recipe from this cookie! I do stuff like this at work all the time.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Really?!

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Yeah! I bet I can do it.
(Chandler looks over and sees Ross glaring at them.)

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Okay, we owe you a present.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Two! I’ve been engaged twice!

content.description: The Mr. Bowmont (Joey’s boat), she’s shown to be in one of the waterways around New York, but in reality she’s in a sound stage on the Warner Bros. lot and we see New York from the water in some rather poor green screen shots. Rachel and Joey are on board.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Look at this clown! Just because he’s got a bigger boat he thinks he can take up the whole river. (Yelling) Get out of the way jackass! (To Rachel) Who names his boat Coast Guard anyway?

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: That is the Coast Guard.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: What are they doing out here? The coast’s all the way over there. (Points to the coast, meanwhile there is coast behind him.)

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Joey, just ignore the boats all right? We’re not finished with the lesson yet.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: All right.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Okay, I’m just gonna go over the basic points just one more time, are you ready?

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Come on Rach, not again. I got it! Okay? Let’s start sailing, and I want to go over there (Points) where that boatload of girls is! (Yelling to them) Yo-ho-ho!

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Oh, okay. Is that what you want to do? You wanna go over and give a little shout out to the old, hot chickas? Okay, let’s do that Sailor Joe. Quick question though, (grabs some of the rigging) what’s this called?

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Uh, boat rope.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Wrong! How do you get the mainsail up?

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Uh, rub it?

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: No. What do you do if I say we are coming about?

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: I’d say, come again. No-no, wait I-I-I know this one, I know this one, uh…
(Rachel blasts an air horn in his ear.)

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Time’s up, now you’re dead.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: And deaf!

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Okay, you just go on and make your little jokey-jokes, but if you do not know what you are doing out at sea you will die at sea. Am I getting through to you sailor?! (She punctuates each word by slapping him on the forehead.)

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Yes.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Don’t just say yes! This isn’t a game, Joey, you can really get hurt out here. Okay, so do you want to pay attention or do you want to die?!

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: I want to make a ship to shore call to Chandler.

content.description: Monica, Chandler, and Phoebe’s, Monica and Phoebe are trying to determine the cookie recipe by eating small pieces.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: All right, I definitely taste nutmeg.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: You do?

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: You don’t? (Laughs) Well, that’s the difference between a professional and a layman.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: That and arrogance.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Hey.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Hey! How was sailing?

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: I don’t want to talk about it. Y’know, you could’ve at least saved me a whole cookie. (He grabs what’s left of the cookie and pops in his mouth.)

content.speaker: Monica and Phoebe
content.text: No-wait-no-no!!!!!!!

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Women are mean!!! (Storms out.)

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: I can’t believe that! Now the only thing left of my grandmother’s legacy is this crumb. (She picks it up with her finger and holds it out to Monica.) I wish you a long and happy marriage.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Hey.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Hey! How was it?

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Well I had a great time! Umm, Chancy on the other hand…

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: I will tell the story! It was going great. I let him win. We were bonding. He even said I could call him dad.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: And what did he ask you not to call him?

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Daddy. All right look, here’s the story. (Flashback to Chandler about to enter the steam room as he does the voice-over.) Well, we had just finished playing racquetball and we were gonna take a steam. I walk into the steam room and it was really steamy. (The flashback shows his glasses fog up and him trying to find his way around the steam-filled room. He takes off his glasses.) So I take off my glasses and that’s when it happened.
[Cut to the flashback, Chandler’s no longer doing the voice-over.]

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Guys?

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Over here. (You can see Ross sitting at the far wall.)

content.speaker: Mr. Geller
content.text: Have a seat son. (You can see Mr. Geller sitting closer to the door as Chandler walks over and sits in his lap.) Hey!! (Chandler quickly jumps off and sits next to him with a shocked expression on his face.)

content.description: Monica, Chandler, and Phoebe’s, Chandler is finished telling everyone what happened.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Oh my God Chandler! I can’t believe it!

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: I know.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: You gave my father a lap dance!

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Why do they put so much steam in there?!

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: ‘Cause otherwise they’d have to call it the room room.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Why? Okay? Why? Wh-wh-why did that have to happen?

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Come on, it’s not that big a deal!

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Not that big a deal? There…there was touching of things.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Now, I know you wanted to bond with my dad, but did you really have to bond to that part?

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Listen, I’m sure that dad doesn’t care. He probably thought this was funny; he’ll be telling this story for years!

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: I don’t want him to tell this story for years.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Oh, but he will. He still tells the story how Monica tried to escape from fat camp.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: I wasn’t escaping.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Then how did you get caught in the barbed wire?

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: I was trying to help out a squirrel.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: You were trying to eat it!
(The phone rings.)

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: If that is your father calling to tell this story then the marriage is off!

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Come on. (Answering phone) Hello? (Listens) I’m sorry you have the wrong number. (Listens) (Whispering) Okay, I’ll call you later dad. I love you. (Hangs up.)

content.description: Central Perk, Chandler, Ross, and Rachel are there.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: All right, I’m off to see your dad.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Whoa-whoa, aren’t you a little over dressed?

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Yeah, and-and you better make sure he tips you this time.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Look, I figured I would try to convince him not to tell the story anymore, and I figure the best way to do that is face to face—And by face I don’t mean his lap. And by face, I don’t mean my ass. (Exits.)

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Hey are you getting Monica and Chandler an engagement present?

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: I don’t know. Y’know, they didn’t get us anything.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Thank you!

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Hey.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Hey.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Well hello! So, when are we gettin’ back out on the water matey?

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Oh uh, I don’t know the boat way to say this, but uh never!

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Why not?

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Because! You’re mean on the boat!

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: What? I was just trying to teach you.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Well, lesson learned! Rachel is mean!

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Yeeeeeep… Yep-yep-yep-yep-yep. I remember when she took me out on her dad’s boat she wouldn’t let me help at all.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Excuse me, I wanted you to help, but you couldn’t move your arms because you were wearing three life jackets.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: You have to respect the sea! (Storms off.)

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Look Joey, I’m sorry if-if you thought that was mean, but I gotta tell ya something. That was not mean. Okay, my father is mean. He used to yell at me all the time on the boat, I mean it was horrible. I was just being a good teacher.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Does a good teacher say, “Put down the beer pinhead!?”

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Well, does a good student drink seven beers during his first lesson?

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Six and a half! You knocked that last one out of my hand! Remember?

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Yeah, I didn’t want you to get hit by the boom!

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Well it hit me anyway! And it would’ve hurt a lot less if I had finished that last beer.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: All right, y’know what? I-I’m sorry. I will try to tone it down and uh stop yelling.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: You won’t boss me around anymore?

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: I won’t boss you around.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: And you’ll be nice?

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: And, I’ll be nice.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: And you’ll be topless?

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: And—Joey!

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Do you want me to learn?!

content.description: Monica, Chandler, and Phoebe’s, Monica is trying out different cookie recipes. Ross and Phoebe are the tasting group.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Okay, here’s batch 22. Oh, maybe these’ll taste a little like your grandmother’s. This has a little bit of orange peel, but no nutmeg.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Let’s give it a shot.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Okay. Man, I have not made this many cookies since I was in the ninth grade.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Oh, what was that for? Like a bake sale?

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: No, just a Friday night.
(They all take a bite.)

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Oh, these are pretty good.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Yeah, but not as good as batch 17.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Which one was that?

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: The ones we had right after you almost threw up.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Oh yeah! Batch 17 was good. I did not like batch 16. (Burps a little bit.) I’m okay.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Are there any more from the good batch? ‘Cause we could just work off of those.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Yeah, ooh yeah, I think there is one from batch 17 left, uh… (Grabs a cookie and takes a big bite out of it and doesn’t like it.) It’s batch 16! 16 people! Get out of the way! (Gets up and runs for the bathroom.)

content.description: The Mr. Bowmont, it’s Joey’s second lesson with Rachel as the resident sailing expert.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Okay Joey honey, you’re doing really good! All right, now I’m just gonna need you to step to the port side. (Joey pauses as he tries to remember which side is the port side.) Remember? Remember how we talked about the port side?

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Oh yeah.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Right?

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Nope.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: It’s left sweetie, but that’s okay sweetie, that’s a tough one.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: I don’t know why you just don’t say left.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Okay, go to the left. (Joey goes starboard or sits on the right side of the boat.) The left!

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Huh?

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Just sit over there!! (Points to the port side.)

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Okay! Okay, you’re yelling again! See that?

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: No! No-no, no-no-no, very quiet, said with love, no yelling.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Oh, y’know what? Since I’m here, I think I’m gonna have me a little beer on the port side. (Grabs and opens one.)

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Okay Joey, we’re luffing a little bit, so could you tighten up the cunningham? (The mainsail has started to flap in the wind and has stopped working efficiently; she wants him to tighten it so that it starts working again.)

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Uh, wow, you just said a bunch of stuff I didn’t know there.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Joey, come on! We just went over this! (She does it instead.)

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Oh, y’know, when we did that was when that bird was flying overhead with the fish in his mouth. Did you see it? It was gross!

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: No! All right?! I did not see the bird! I did not see the fish! I did not see the piece of Styrofoam that was shaped like Mike Tyson! I did not , because I was trying to teach you how to sail a boat! Which obviously is an impossible thing to do!

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: All right that’s it! You’re yelling and I don’t see you taking your top off! I quit!

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: What do you mean you quit?! You can’t quit!

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Why not?!

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Because you’re not finished yet and I won’t have it! Greens do not quit!

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Greens? I’m a Tribbiani! And Tribbianis quit!

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Oh my God, wait did I—I just said Greens don’t quit didn’t I? (Pause) (Angrily) Did I just say Greens don’t quit?!

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Yes! Yes! You did and you’re still yelling at me!

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: No! No! No! I’m not yelling at you, I’m just yelling near you. Oh God Joey, oh I’m my father. Oh my God, this is horrible! I’ve been trying so hard not to be my mother I did not see this comin’. Oh, Joey, I’m sorry. I’m so sorry. I just wanted you to learn.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Well, hey I did learn.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Really?

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Yeah! Come on.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Awww…

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Yeah, it’s okay. I know what a mainsail is. (Points to it. It’s the larger sail.) I know, I know to duck when the boom comes across. I-I know port is right.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Left.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Damnit!

content.description: Monica, Chandler, and Phoebe’s, the cookie-trying period has passed. Monica, Phoebe, and Ross are reflecting on the day’s events.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Y’know, I bet it would actually make my grandmother very happy to know that we’re trying to figure out her recipe. I bet she’s l-l-lookin’ up at us and smiling right now.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Looking up?

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Oh yeah—No, she was really nice to me, but she’s in hell for sure.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Well, I’ve tried everything. I give up. I guess I’m not gonna be the mom who makes the world’s best chocolate cookies. I do make the best duck confit with broccoli rabe. Kids love that right.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Aww, Pheeb, come on isn’t there any relative that would have the recipe? What about, what about your sister?

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Oh no-no, no, I made a promise to myself that the next time I would talk to Ursula would be over my dead body. And that’s not happening ‘til October 15 th , 2032.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: That’s the day you’re gonna die? See—darnit, I’ve got shuffleboard that day.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: That’s what you think.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Well, I mean what about friends of your grandmother’s? Wouldn’t they have the recipe?

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Well, y’know I may have relatives in France who would know. My grandmother said she got the recipe from her grandmother, Nesele Tolouse.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: What was her name?

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Nesele Toulouse.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Nestle Tollhouse ?!

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Oh, you Americans always butcher the French language.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Phoebe, is this the recipe? (Tosses her the bag.)
content.parenthetical: grabbing a bag of Nestle Tollhouse chocolate chips

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Yes!! (Realizes.) Oh.
content.parenthetical: reading the recipe on the back of the bag

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: I cannot believe that I just spent the last two days trying to figure out the recipe and it was in my cupboard the whole time!

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: I know! You see it is stuff like this which is why (Looking down) you’re burning in hell!!

content.description: The Gym, Chandler and Mr. Geller are heading for the whirlpool room.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: So you understand, I’d feel a lot more comfortable if you didn’t tell people what happened. Y’know, I’m a little…I’m a little embarrassed about it.

content.speaker: Mr. Geller
content.text: I understand completely, there’s nothing more horrifying than embarrassing yourself in front of your in-laws. As a matter of fact, when I started dating Judy I was unemployed, and her father asked me what I did for a living and I told him I was a lawyer.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: What did you do when they found out?

content.speaker: Mr. Geller
content.text: They never did, so if you ever see me giving them legal advice just nod along. Shall we?

(Chandler nods along and they enter the whirlpool room and remove their robes. Only Chandler is lacking a certain item of clothing. You see this is a coed whirlpool, which means swimsuits, and in fact there are two women already there and Chandler didn’t seem to wear his. Needless to say, everyone is shocked, including Chandler.)

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: So I guess we wear swimsuits in here!

content.description: The Mr. Bowmont, is tied up alongside the pier; Joey and Rachel are relaxing.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Well Joey, I hate to admit it, your way of sailing is a lot more fun.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Yeah, yeah. Hey, why don’t you give a pull on that rope? (Points.)

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Oh we’re not sailing.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Just pull on it.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: All right. (She does so and it brings the cooler closer together.) Hey-hey-hey!! (Sees what’s in the cooler.) Sandwiches!

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: What else?

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Here you go.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Thank you.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Oh wow! (She takes a bite, but holds the sandwich vertically so that the stuff falls out.)

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: What are you doing?

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Oh, sorry.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: What you—don’t hold it like that! You’re lettin’ all the good stuff fall out.
(More falls out.)

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Oh whoops.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Careful! You’re wasting good pastrami! (Gasps.) Oh my God! I’m my dad!
